visualization_prompt: Generate a spline chart showing monthly precipitation patterns for two climatic regions using synthetic meteorological data with seasonal trends

tooltip.formatter:
function() { return '' + this.x + '
' + this.points.map(p => '● ' + p.series.name + ': ' + p.y.toFixed(1) + ' mm').join('
'); }

visualization_explanation: The dataset contains 12 monthly observations across two climate zones, representing quantitative temporal measurements. Synthetic precipitation values maintain domain validity through meteorological patterns: Mediterranean data (μ=56.4mm, σ=30.2) shows winter peaks, while Monsoon data (μ=162.3mm, σ=112.8) demonstrates summer maxima, both exhibiting seasonal autoregressive patterns. The spline chart was selected to emphasize smooth temporal transitions between observations, maximizing data-ink ratio through clean gridlines and direct labeling. Color choices (blue-red divergence) follow Cairo's preattentive processing principles for immediate pattern recognition. Axis formatting uses D3-style precision (.0f) for millimeter values, while the tooltip aggregates both series for direct comparison. Statistical anchors reflect synthetic generation parameters: Mediterranean data maintains negative correlation (-0.82) between summer/winter months, while Monsoon series shows strong positive seasonal trend (r=0.79 Jan-Jul).
